document.docAuthor: Flechtmann, Carlos H. W., De, Gilberto J. & Moraes
document.masterDocTitle: New genus and species of eriophyid mites (Acari, Eriophyidae) from Myrtaceae in Brazil, with notes on damages caused by Aculus pitangae Boczek & Davis

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New genus and species of eriophyid mites (Acari, Eriophyidae) from Myrtaceae in Brazil, with notes on damages caused by Aculus pitangae Boczek & Davis

subSubSection.paragraph: DIAGNOSIS ­ Admedian lines forming an inverted keyhole shaped figure on prodorsal shield; empodia 4 ­rayed and solenidia ending in large knobs. Female tibia I with a small solenidion­like structure next to basis of tibial setae.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 2.
Calacarus kleithriae Flechtmann
n.sp.
CGF, coxigenital area of female; D, dorsal aspect of female; GM, male genitalia (enlarged); IGF, internal genital structures of female; L, lateral aspect of female; L1, leg I (enlarged); L2, leg II (enlarged); Ti I, tibia I (enlarged), dorsal aspect.

subSubSection.paragraph:
MALE (n = 3 ) ­ Smaller than female, 159­164, 57 ­ 69 wide. Gnathosoma: basal seta 3­4 ; antapical seta 9­10 ; chelicera 25­27 . Prodorsal shield: 45­48, 55 ­ 60 wide. Legs: leg
I 33
­37; femur 10­11 , bv 10­12 ; genu 5­7 , l" 28­32 ; tibia 7­9 , l' 7­9 , no indication of a solenidion­like structure; tarsus 7­8 , solenidion 6­7 , empodium 4­6, 4 ­rayed, ft' 17­23 , ft" 19­25 , u' 4­5 . Leg
II 32
­34; femur 8­11 , bv 10­11 ; genu 3­5 , l" 5­6 ; tibia 9­10 ; tarsus 6­7 , solenidion 6­7 , empodium 5­6, 4 ­rayed, ft' 6­8 , ft" 17­22 , u' 3­4 . Coxigenital area:
1 b
7­ 8, 11 ­ 13 apart;
1a 11
­ 13, 8 ­ 9 apart;
2a 33
­ 42, 23 ­ 24 apart. Coxigenital area with 11­13 annuli, microtuberculate. Genitalia: 18­20 wide, 13­14 long, granulated;
3a 11
­ 13 . Opisthosoma:
c
2
18­25 , on annulus 3­4 ; d 55­61, 28 ­ 31 apart, on annulus 15­19 ; e 19­22, 13 ­ 15 apart, on annulus 32­37 ; f 23­26, 23 ­ 26 apart, on annulus 50­56 or 7 th­ 9 th from rear;
h 2
73­84 ;
h 1
missing. Total dorsal annuli 63­72 ; total ventral annuli 56­64 .

TYPE
MATERIAL ­
female holotype ,
30 female
,
6 male
paratypes , from
Eugenia

uniflora
L. ( Myrtaceae ), "pitanga", Piracicaba, São Paulo, Brazil (
22 ° 40 ' 32 " S
,
47 ° 38 ' 00" W
),
08 July 2002
, coll. L.C. Lofego, on 10 microscopic preparations.

RELATION TO HOST ­
vagrant on the upper leaf surface.

ETYMOLOGY ­ The specific designation
kleithria
is a Greek word meaning keyhole and refers to the inverted figure formed by admedian lines on the prodorsal shield.

REMARKS ­ Dorsum of tibia I in the female of the new species with a small solenidion­like structure inserted near the base of the tibial seta. A similar structure was described by
Flechtmann ( 1999 )
for
Shevtchenkella gnatholoba
.
